revised_title: Ardaseer Cursetjee: The First Indian Fellow of the Royal Society of London
tldr: The article discusses Ardaseer Cursetjee, the first Indian Fellow of the Royal Society of London, who was elected in 1841. Cursetjee was a marine engineer from Bombay and played a significant role in the development of science in India during the British colonial era. His achievements highlight the contributions of the Parsi community to science and technology in India.
